items.sentence: I think Tom may come to Boston for Thanksgiving.
I think Tom has decided to study French instead.
I think Tom goes to Boston at least once a year.
I should've told Tom why he had to go to Boston.
I really should've told Tom not to go to Boston.
I don't think Tom will be in Boston next spring.
I don't think that I've ever been fooled before.
The firefighters couldn't extinguish the flames.
Tom took a deep breath and then started talking.
I wondered if I'd ever really understood anyone.
I'd already gone to bed when the telephone rang.
I don't think the house is as big as we'd hoped.
The police think that Tom's death was a suicide.
I wonder if Tom is still singing with that band.
I don't know what Tom's reaction is going to be.
I'll get back to you as soon as I hear anything.
We'll figure out how to solve the problem later.
I'll have to get a new exhaust pipe for the car.
I'll give it a try, but don't get your hopes up.
We'll have to have a man-to-man talk about this.
